articles.description: More than 30 cases of coronavirus were diagnosed in North Somerset over the weekend.
articles.content:
PUBLISHED: 11:29 20 April 2020 | UPDATED: 11:29 20 April 2020
Harriet Clugston & Vicky Angear
Rise in coronavirus cases in North Somerset over the weekend.
Archant
Official figures show 32 more cases were recorded in the area between Thursday and Sund… [+1053 chars]

articles.author: By Vanessa Chalmers Health Reporter For Mailonline
articles.title: Scientist leading Britain's coronavirus vaccine urges Government to produce millions of doses - Daily Mail
articles.description: Professor Sarah Gilbert, leading the Oxford vaccine team, said Government support will be needed to make the billions of jabs needed across the globe.
articles.content:
An Oxford scientists leading Britain's coronavirus vaccine race has urged the Government to help produce millions of doses before it has proven to be effective.
Professor Sarah Gilbert said her team needed help manufacturing the jabs, warning the UK did not … [+11927 chars]

articles.title: CORONAVIRUS: Nurse who worked until she was 84 dies at GWH - Swindon Advertiser
articles.description: A NURSE who worked until she was 84 has died in Swindon after testing positive for Covid-19.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Hay fever or coronavirus: The symptoms compared - BBC News
articles.description: The Royal College of General Practitioners is warning people not to mix up the symptoms.

articles.author: Sophie Harris
articles.title: Hay fever: If you have these seven symptoms you could be having an allergic reaction - Express
articles.description: HAY FEVER is an allergic reaction to pollen and many Brits suffer with it every year. There are many different symptoms that come with the different types of allergies. But what are the key symptoms people should be looking out for?

articles.author: https://www.facebook.com/bbcnews
articles.title: Coronavirus: Hay fever symptoms could mimic Covid-19, GPs warn - BBC News
articles.description: Doctors warn those allergic to pollen to consider if their reaction has changed from previous years.
articles.content:
Media captionHow can you tell if it's hay fever or coronavirus?
People with hay fever should not confuse their reaction to pollen with the symptoms of coronavirus, GPs say.
While many symptoms - such as a runny nose - are different, hay fever can also promp… [+1434 chars]
